intro: Melampyrum nakaianum, commonly known as the New Zealand touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a reddish or purplish tinge. This species is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, typically in forest understories.
